sen.j: 京極 高和（きょうごく たかかず、元和 (日本)5年3月10日 (旧暦)（1619年4月24日） - 寛文2年9月13日 (旧暦)（1662年11月3日））は、外様大名である京極氏の江戸時代初期の当主。
sen.e: Takakazu KYOGOKU (April 24, 1619 - November 3, 1662) was the head of Kyogoku clan, tozama daimyo (nonhereditary feudal lord), in the early Edo period.
Takakazu KYOGOKU (April 24, 1619 - October 24, 1662) was the head of Kyogoku clan, tozama daimyo (nonhereditary feudal lord), in the early Edo period.
sen.cmt: グレゴリオ暦に直しました。
sen.e: Takakazu KYOGOKU (April 24, 1619 - October 24, 1662) was the head of Kyogoku clan, tozama daimyo (nonhereditary feudal lord), in the early Edo period.

sen.j: 播磨国龍野藩主、讃岐国丸亀藩初代藩主。
sen.e: He was the lord of Tatsuno domain of the Harima Province and the first lord of Marugame domain of the Sanuki Province.
He was the lord of Tatsuno domain of the Harima Province and the first lord of Marugame domain of the Sanuki Province.
He was the lord of Tatsuno domain of the Harima Province and the first lord of Marugame domain of the Sanuki Province.

sen.j: 丸亀藩京極家3代。
sen.e: He was the third generation of the Kyogoku family of Marugame domain.
He was the third generation of the Kyogoku family of Marugame domain.
He was the third generation of the Kyogoku family of Marugame domain.

sen.j: 安毛高政（京極氏当主京極忠高の弟）の長男。
sen.e: He was the eldest son of Takamasa ANGE (the younger brother of Tadataka KYOGOKU, the head of Kyogoku clan).
He was the oldest son of Takamasa ANGE (the younger brother of Tadataka KYOGOKU, the head of Kyogoku clan).
sen.cmt: 統一リストに合わせました。
sen.e: He was the oldest son of Takamasa ANGE (the younger brother of Tadataka KYOGOKU, the head of Kyogoku clan).

sen.j: 正室は藤堂高次の娘市子。
sen.e: His lawful wife was Ichiko, Takatsugu TODO's daughter.
His lawful wife was Ichiko, Takatsugu TODO's daughter.
His lawful wife was Ichiko, Takatsugu TODO's daughter.

sen.j: 子は京極高豊（次男）、阿久里（宗義真正室）、宮子（今出川公規室）。
sen.e: His children were Takatoyo KYOGOKU (the second son), Aguri (Yoshizane SO's lawful wife), and Miyako (Kinnori IMADEGAWA's wife).
His children were Takatoyo KYOGOKU (the second son), Aguri (Yoshizane SO's lawful wife), and Miyako (Kinnori IMADEGAWA's wife).
sen.cmt: 余分なスペースを削除しました。
sen.e: His children were Takatoyo KYOGOKU (the second son), Aguri (Yoshizane SO's lawful wife), and Miyako (Kinnori IMADEGAWA's wife).

sen.j: 正室所生は阿久里のほか、早世した長男小法師と次女熊子。
sen.e: Children of his lawful wife were Aguri, the eldest son Koboshi who died early, and the second daughter Kumako.
Children of his lawful wife were Aguri, the oldest son Koboshi who died young, and the second daughter Kumako.
sen.cmt: 統一リストに合わせました。
sen.e: Children of his lawful wife were Aguri, the oldest son Koboshi who died young, and the second daughter Kumako.

sen.j: 側室房子所生は次男・高豊。
sen.e: Child of his concubine, Fusako was the second son Takatoyo.
Child of his concubine, Fusako, was the second son Takatoyo.
Child of his concubine, Fusako, was the second son Takatoyo.

sen.j: 側室熊谷氏所生は宮子。
sen.e: Child of his concubine of Kumagai clan, was Miyako.
Child of his concubine of Kumagai clan, was Miyako.
Child of his concubine of Kumagai clan, was Miyako.

sen.j: 幼名は小法師。
sen.e: His childhood name was Koboshi.
His childhood name was Koboshi.
His childhood name was Koboshi.

sen.j: 官位は従五位下刑部少輔。
sen.e: His official rank was Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade), Gyobushoyu (deputy minister of Justice department).
His official rank was Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade), Gyobushoyu (deputy minister of Justice department).
His official rank was Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade), Gyobushoyu (deputy minister of Justice department).

sen.j: 1619年（元和 (日本)5年）3月10日生まれ。
sen.e: He was born on April 24, 1619.
He was born on April 24, 1619.
He was born on April 24, 1619.

sen.j: 1631年（寛永8年）に叙任する。
sen.e: He had Jonin(investiture) in 1631.
He had Jonin (investiture) in 1631.
sen.cmt: スペース補足しました。
sen.e: He had Jonin (investiture) in 1631.

sen.j: 1637年（寛永14年）に松江藩26万石の藩主であった伯父の忠高が嫡子を残さずに亡くなった為、その末期養子となり、播磨龍野6万石へと減封される。
sen.e: Since his uncle Tadataka, who was the head of Matsue domain, 260,000 koku (approximately 46.8 million liters of crop yield), died without any legitimate child, he was adopted and his territory was diminished to Tatsuno domain of the Harima Province, 60,000 koku (approximately 10.8 million liters of crop yield).

Since his uncle Tadataka, who was the head of Matsue domain, 260,000 koku (approximately 46.8 million liters of crop yield), died without any legitimate child in 1637, he was adopted on his deathbed and his territory was diminished to 60,000 koku (approximately 10.8 million liters of crop yield), Tatsuno domain of the Harima Province.
sen.cmt: 訳漏れ。「1637年に」を補足し、他表現を変えました。
sen.e: Since his uncle Tadataka, who was the head of Matsue domain, 260,000 koku (approximately 46.8 million liters of crop yield), died without any legitimate child in 1637, he was adopted on his deathbed and his territory was diminished to 60,000 koku (approximately 10.8 million liters of crop yield), Tatsuno domain of the Harima Province.

sen.j: 1658年（万治元年）に讃岐丸亀5万石と播磨国揖保郡網干1万石の計6万石に移封となる。
sen.e: He was transferred to Marugame domain of the Sakuki Province, 50,000 koku (approximately 9 million liters of crop yield) and Aboshi, Ibo-gun of Harima Province, 10,000 koku (approximately 1.8 million liters of crop yield), total of 60,000 koku (approximately 10.8 million liters of crop yield) in 1658.

He was transferred to Marugame domain of the Sakuki Province, 50,000 koku (approximately 9 million liters of crop yield) and Aboshi, Ibo County of Harima Province, 10,000 koku (approximately 1.8 million liters of crop yield), total of 60,000 koku (approximately 10.8 million liters of crop yield) in 1658.

He was transferred to Marugame domain of the Sakuki Province, 50,000 koku (approximately 9 million liters of crop yield) and Aboshi, Ibo County of Harima Province, 10,000 koku (approximately 1.8 million liters of crop yield), total of 60,000 koku (approximately 10.8 million liters of crop yield) in 1658.

sen.j: 1660年（万治3年）には讃岐にあり広く信仰されていた金刀比羅宮を江戸三田の藩邸に勧請した。
sen.e: Kotohira-gu Shrine, that was widely believed in Sanuki Province, had kanjo (ceremonial transfer of a divided tutelary deity to a new location) to domain's residence in Mita of Edo in 1660.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: He had kanjo (ceremonial transfer of a divided tutelary deity to a new location) Kotohira-gu Shrine, that was widely believed and located in Sanuki Province, to domain's residence in Mita of Edo in 1660.

He had kanjo (ceremonial transfer of a divided tutelary deity to a new location) Kotohira-gu Shrine, that was widely believed and located in Sanuki Province, to domain's residence in Mita of Edo in 1660.

sen.j: それから、参拝を願う江戸の町民に応え、毎月10日には邸内を開いて参拝させた。
sen.e: Then, in order to respond to Edo people's wish to visit the shrine to pray, he had Edo people visit the shrine to pray by opening the residence to the public on tenth every month.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Then, in order to respond to Edo people's wish to visit the shrine to pray, he had Edo people visit the shrine to pray by opening the residence to the public on 10th every month.
Then, in order to respond to Edo people's wish to visit the shrine to pray, he had Edo people visit the shrine to pray by opening the residence to the public on 10th every month.

sen.j: また、この年には丸亀城の天守を完成させる。
sen.e: Also, he completed Marugame-jo Castle keep in this year.
Also, he completed the keep tower of Marugame-jo Castle in this year.
Also, he completed the keep tower of Marugame-jo Castle in this year.

sen.j: 1662年（寛文2年）に京都において44歳で亡くなり、徳源院恃英遺達大居士との法名を贈られる。
sen.e: He died at the age of forty four in Kyoto in 1662 and was sent homyo (a name given to a person who enters the Buddhist priesthood) of Tokugenin Jiei Itatsu Daikoji.
He died at the age of 44 in Kyoto in 1662 and was sent homyo (a name given to a person who enters the Buddhist priesthood) of Tokugenin Jiei Itatsu Daikoji.
He died at the age of 44 in Kyoto in 1662 and was sent homyo (a name given to a person who enters the Buddhist priesthood) of Tokugenin Jiei Itatsu Daikoji.

sen.j: 墓所は滋賀県坂田郡山東町の徳源院。
sen.e: His grave is in Tokugen-in Temple in Santo-cho, Sakata-gun, Shiga Prefecture.
His grave is located in Tokugenin Temple in Santo Town, Sakata County, Shiga Prefecture.
His grave is located in Tokugenin Temple in Santo Town, Sakata County, Shiga Prefecture.

sen.j: 後を次男・高豊が継いだ。
sen.e: His successor was his second son Takatoyo.
His successor was his second son Takatoyo.
His successor was his second son Takatoyo.

sen.j: 異説
sen.e: Heresy
Heresy
Heresy

sen.j: 高和は先代当主・忠高の甥というのが通説である。
sen.e: The popular theory was that Takakazu was the nephew of Tadataka, the former family head.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The popular theory was that Takakazu was the nephew of Tadataka, the former family head.
The popular theory was that Takakazu was the nephew of Tadataka, the former family head.

sen.j: しかし、実は忠高が側女との間に儲けた男子を、正室・初姫とその実家の徳川家をはばかって「甥」として届け出たという説がある。
sen.e: However, there was the heresy that Tadataka reported the male child born between Tadataka and his concubine as 'nephew' in order to avoid the attention of his lawful wife Hatsuhime and her family home, Tokugawa family.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, there was the heresy that Tadataka reported the male child born between Tadataka and his concubine as 'nephew' in order to avoid the attention of his lawful wife Hatsuhime and her family home, Tokugawa family.

However, there was the heresy that Tadataka reported the male child born between Tadataka and his concubine as 'nephew' in order to avoid the attention of his lawful wife Hatsuhime and her family home, Tokugawa family.
